Comments_List: This course was great in teaching both the history, as well as the evolution of religion and worship of Judaism in the ancient world! I learned a lot about the history surrounding the evolution of the religion, as well as involving the worshippers themselves.

Tons of knowledge about the ancient world - Judaism (duh), history, classical civilization, Hellenistic culture, Roman Empire. Great class, lots of different time periods. Also never taken class involving Bible before, great introduction. Prof Fraade is great - been teaching the class for 40 years, very nice guy.
I learned about the development of Ancient Judaism from a group religion in its early history to more of a individualized religion.
The reading material for this course really helped focus the discussions, and I enjoyed that the professor led the discussions but allowed ample time for students to speak.

Strengths: succinct, to-the-point readings, extremely knowledgeable professor, clearly an expert

Weaknesses: more days (and parts of class) devoted to class discussion (though Prof Fraade does an excellent job facilitating these discussions)

I would definitely recommend this course to another student, whether taking it for the major or not, as it helps provide a lot of historical context to the evolution of the Jewish religion from the period of the 1st temple through Roman rule.
Yes - great professor, fair workload, learn a lot but not overwhelming
Yes, you should take this course if you are interested in learning about the development of Ancient Judaism.
